intro: Ferula microcolea, commonly known as the narrow-headed ferula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, aromatic resin that has been used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Ferula microcolea thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates.
